name: Hydrogen
summary: Hydrogen is the lightest element, consisting of one proton and one electron.
mnemonic: Hum (Group 1: H-Li-Na-K-Rb-Cs-Fr -> Hum LiNa Ki Rab Se Fariyad)

name: Helium
summary: Helium is a colorless, odorless, tasteless, non-toxic, inert, monatomic gas.
mnemonic: He (Group 18: He-Ne-Ar-Kr-Xe-Rn -> He Ne Ar Kar Xe Rn)

name: Lithium
summary: Lithium is a soft, silvery-white alkali metal and the lightest metal.

name: Beryllium
summary: Beryllium is a divalent element that occurs naturally only in combination with other elements in minerals.
mnemonic: Beta (Beta Mange Car Scooter Baap Razi)

name: Boron
summary: Boron is a metalloid found in small amounts in meteoroids, but not naturally on Earth.
discovered_by: Joseph Louis Gay-Lussac and Louis Jacques Thénard

name: Carbon
summary: Carbon is a nonmetal and tetravalent—making four electrons available to form covalent chemical bonds.

name: Nitrogen
summary: Nitrogen is a common nonmetal, a colorless, odorless, tasteless and mostly inert diatomic gas at standard conditions.

name: Oxygen
summary: Oxygen is a highly reactive nonmetal, and an oxidizing agent that readily forms oxides with most elements.

name: Fluorine
summary: Fluorine is the lightest halogen and exists as a highly toxic pale yellow diatomic gas at standard conditions.

name: Neon
summary: Neon is a colorless, odorless, inert monatomic gas under standard conditions.
mnemonic: Ne (He Ne Ar Kar Xe Rn)

name: Sodium
summary: Sodium is a soft, silvery-white, highly reactive alkali metal.

name: Magnesium
summary: Magnesium is a shiny gray solid which bears a close physical resemblance to the other five elements in the second column (group 2, or alkaline earth metals) of the periodic table.
mnemonic: Mange (Beta Mange Car Scooter Baap Razi)

name: Aluminium
summary: Aluminium is a silvery-white, soft, non-magnetic and ductile metal in the boron group.

name: Silicon
summary: Silicon is a hard, brittle crystalline solid with a blue-grey metallic lustre; and it is a tetravalent metalloid and semiconductor.

name: Phosphorus
summary: Phosphorus is a multivalent nonmetal of the nitrogen group.

name: Sulfur
summary: Sulfur is a bright yellow, crystalline solid at room temperature.

name: Chlorine
summary: Chlorine is a yellow-green gas under standard conditions, where it forms diatomic molecules.

name: Argon
summary: Argon is the third-most abundant gas in the Earth's atmosphere.
mnemonic: Ar (He Ne Ar Kar Xe Rn)

name: Potassium
summary: Potassium is a soft silvery-white alkali metal that oxidizes rapidly in air and reacts vigorously with water.

name: Calcium
summary: Calcium is a soft gray alkaline earth metal, fifth-most abundant element by mass in the Earth's crust.
mnemonic: Car (Beta Mange Car Scooter Baap Razi)

name: Scandium
summary: Scandium is a silvery-white metallic d-block element.
mnemonic: School (School Teacher Vineeta Criplani Man Fenko Ni Kyun Zaan)

name: Titanium
summary: Titanium is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density, and high strength.

name: Vanadium
summary: Vanadium is a hard, silvery-grey, ductile, and malleable transition metal.

name: Chromium
summary: Chromium is a steely-grey, lustrous, hard and brittle transition metal.

name: Manganese
summary: Manganese is a transition metal with a multifaceted array of industrial alloy uses, particularly in stainless steels.

name: Iron
summary: Iron is a metal in the first transition series and the most common element on Earth by mass.
mnemonic: Fenko (School Teacher Vineeta Criplani Man Fenko...)

name: Cobalt
summary: Cobalt is a hard, lustrous, silver-gray metal.
mnemonic: Ni (School Teacher Vineeta Criplani Man Fenko Ni...)

name: Nickel
summary: Nickel is a silvery-white lustrous metal with a slight golden tinge.
mnemonic: Kyun (School Teacher Vineeta Criplani Man Fenko Ni Kyun...)

name: Copper
summary: Copper is a soft, malleable, and ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.
mnemonic: Kyun (part of Ni-Cu -> Ni Kyun Zaan)

name: Zinc
summary: Zinc is a slightly brittle metal at room temperature and has a blue-silvery appearance when oxidation is removed.
mnemonic: Zaan (School Teacher Vineeta Criplani Man Fenko Ni Kyun Zaan)

name: Gallium
summary: Gallium is a soft, silvery metal, and elemental gallium is a brittle solid at low temperatures, and melts at 29.76 °C.

name: Germanium
summary: Germanium is a lustrous, hard-to-brittle, grayish-white metalloid in the carbon group.

name: Arsenic
summary: Arsenic is a metalloid that occurs in many minerals, usually in combination with sulfur and metals.

name: Selenium
summary: Selenium is a nonmetal with properties that are intermediate between the elements above and below in the periodic table.

name: Bromine
summary: Bromine is a fuming red-brown liquid at room temperature that evaporates readily to form a similarly coloured gas.

name: Krypton
summary: Krypton is a colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.
mnemonic: Kar (He Ne Ar Kar Xe Rn)

name: Rubidium
summary: Rubidium is a very soft, silvery-white metal in the alkali metal group.

name: Strontium
summary: Strontium is a greyish-white alkaline earth metal that is highly reactive chemically.
mnemonic: Scooter (Beta Mange Car Scooter Baap Razi)

name: Yttrium
summary: Yttrium is a silvery-metallic transition metal chemically similar to the lanthanides.

name: Zirconium
summary: Zirconium is a lustrous, grey-white, strong transition metal that resembles hafnium and titanium.

name: Niobium
summary: Niobium is a light grey, crystalline, and ductile transition metal.

name: Molybdenum
summary: Molybdenum is a transition metal with one of the highest melting points of all pure elements.

name: Technetium
summary: Technetium is a silvery-grey radioactive metal, the lightest element with no stable isotopes.

name: Ruthenium
summary: Ruthenium is a transition metal belonging to the platinum group.
mnemonic: Rukawat (Yaari Zara Nibhana Maut Tak Rukawat...)

name: Rhodium
summary: Rhodium is a rare, silvery-white, hard, and chemically inert transition metal.
mnemonic: Raah (Yaari Zara Nibhana Maut Tak Rukawat Raah...)

name: Palladium
summary: Palladium is a rare and lustrous silvery-white metal discovered in 1803.
mnemonic: Pade (Yaari Zara Nibhana Maut Tak Rukawat Raah Pade...)

name: Silver
summary: Silver is a soft, white, lustrous transition metal, it possesses the highest electrical conductivity of any element.
mnemonic: Aage (Yaari Zara Nibhana Maut Tak Rukawat Raah Pade Aage...)

name: Cadmium
summary: Cadmium is a soft, silvery-white bluish chemically similar to the two other stable metals in group 12.
mnemonic: Aag (Yaari Zara Nibhana Maut Tak Rukawat Raah Pade Aage Aag [Kood])

name: Indium
summary: Indium is a post-transition metal that is very soft and malleable.
discovered_by: Ferdinand Reich and Hieronymous Theodor Richter

name: Tin
summary: Tin is a main group metal in group 14 of the periodic table.

name: Antimony
summary: Antimony is a lustrous gray metalloid.

name: Tellurium
summary: Tellurium is a brittle, mildly toxic, rare, silver-white metalloid.

name: Iodine
summary: Iodine is the heaviest of the stable halogens, existing as a lustrous, purple-black metallic solid at standard conditions.

name: Xenon
summary: Xenon is a colorless, dense, odorless noble gas found in the Earth's atmosphere in trace amounts.
mnemonic: Xe (He Ne Ar Kar Xe Rn)

name: Caesium
summary: Caesium is a soft, silvery-golden alkali metal with a melting point of 28.5 °C.

name: Barium
summary: Barium is a soft, silvery alkaline earth metal.
mnemonic: Baap (Beta Mange Car Scooter Baap Razi)

name: Lanthanum
summary: Lanthanum is a silvery-white, ductile, and soft metal.
mnemonic: La (La Ce Pr Nd... mnemonics vary widely in India)

name: Cerium
summary: Cerium is a soft, ductile, and silvery-white metal that tarnishes when exposed to air.

name: Praseodymium
summary: Praseodymium is a soft, silvery, malleable and ductile metal in the lanthanide group.

name: Neodymium
summary: Neodymium is a soft silvery metal used in high-strength magnets.

name: Promethium
summary: Promethium is a radioactive lanthanide, all isotopes are radioactive.

name: Samarium
summary: Samarium is a moderately hard silvery metal that slowly oxidizes in air.

name: Europium
summary: Europium is the most reactive lanthanide metal, oxidizing quickly in air.

name: Gadolinium
summary: Gadolinium is a silvery-white metal which is ferromagnetic.

name: Terbium
summary: Terbium is a silvery-white, rare earth metal that is malleable, ductile, and soft.

name: Dysprosium
summary: Dysprosium is a rare earth element that has a metallic, bright silver luster.

name: Holmium
summary: Holmium is a relatively soft and malleable rare-earth metal.

name: Erbium
summary: Erbium is a silvery-white solid metal when artificially isolated.

name: Thulium
summary: Thulium is the second-least abundant of the lanthanides.

name: Ytterbium
summary: Ytterbium is a soft, malleable and ductile chemical element.

name: Lutetium
summary: Lutetium is a silvery white metal, which resists corrosion in dry air, but not in moist air.

name: Hafnium
summary: Hafnium is a lustrous, silvery gray, tetravalent transition metal.

name: Tantalum
summary: Tantalum is a hard, blue-gray, lustrous transition metal that is highly corrosion-resistant.

name: Tungsten
summary: Tungsten is a hard steel-grey metal that is often brittle and hard to work.

name: Rhenium
summary: Rhenium is a silvery-white, heavy, third-row transition metal in group 7 of the periodic table.

name: Osmium
summary: Osmium is a hard, brittle, bluish-white transition metal in the platinum group.

name: Iridium
summary: Iridium is a very hard, brittle, silvery-white transition metal of the platinum group.
mnemonic: Ir (La Hafta Warna Re Os Ir...)

name: Platinum
summary: Platinum is a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, precious, silver-white transition metal.
mnemonic: Pt (La Hafta Warna Re Os Ir Pt...)

name: Gold
summary: Gold is a bright, slightly reddish yellow, dense, soft, malleable, and ductile metal.
mnemonic: Au (La Hafta Warna Re Os Ir Pt Au...)

name: Mercury
summary: Mercury is a heavy, silvery d-block element, the only metallic element that is liquid at standard conditions.
mnemonic: Hg (La Hafta Warna Re Os Ir Pt Au Hg...)

name: Thallium
summary: Thallium is a gray post-transition metal that is not found free in nature.

name: Lead
summary: Lead is a heavy metal that is denser than most common materials.

name: Bismuth
summary: Bismuth is a pentavalent post-transition metal and one of the pnictogens.

name: Polonium
summary: Polonium is a radioactive element that has two allotropes.

name: Astatine
summary: Astatine is a radioactive chemical element, and the rarest naturally occurring element in the Earth's crust.

name: Radon
summary: Radon is a radioactive, colorless, odorless, tasteless noble gas.
mnemonic: Rn (He Ne Ar Kar Xe Rn)

name: Francium
summary: Francium is a highly radioactive metal that decays into astatine, radium, and radon.

name: Radium
summary: Radium is a silvery-white, radioactive alkaline earth metal.
mnemonic: Razi (Beta Mange Car Scooter Baap Razi)

name: Actinium
summary: Actinium is a radioactive, soft, silvery-white radioactive metal.
mnemonic: Ac (Ac Th Pa U Np... mnemonics vary)

name: Thorium
summary: Thorium is a weakly radioactive metallic chemical element.

name: Protactinium
summary: Protactinium is a dense, silvery-gray actinide metal which readily reacts with oxygen, water vapor and inorganic acids.

name: Uranium
summary: Uranium is a silvery-white metal in the actinide series of the periodic table.

name: Neptunium
summary: Neptunium is a hard, silvery, ductile, radioactive actinide metal.

name: Plutonium
summary: Plutonium is a radioactive actinide metal that tarnishes in air.

name: Americium
summary: Americium is a radioactive transuranic chemical element.

name: Curium
summary: Curium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element.

name: Berkelium
summary: Berkelium is a transuranic radioactive chemical element.

name: Californium
summary: Californium is a radioactive metallic chemical element.

name: Einsteinium
summary: Einsteinium is a synthetic element and actinide.

name: Fermium
summary: Fermium is a synthetic element and actinide.

name: Mendelevium
summary: Mendelevium is a synthetic element and actinide.

name: Nobelium
summary: Nobelium is a synthetic element and actinide.

name: Lawrencium
summary: Lawrencium is a synthetic element and actinide.

name: Rutherfordium
summary: Rutherfordium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Dubnium
summary: Dubnium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Seaborgium
summary: Seaborgium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Bohrium
summary: Bohrium is a synthetic chemical element.
discovered_by: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research

name: Hassium
summary: Hassium is a synthetic chemical element.
discovered_by: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research

name: Meitnerium
summary: Meitnerium is a synthetic chemical element.
discovered_by: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research

name: Darmstadtium
summary: Darmstadtium is a synthetic chemical element.
discovered_by: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research

name: Roentgenium
summary: Roentgenium is a synthetic chemical element.
discovered_by: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research

name: Copernicium
summary: Copernicium is a synthetic chemical element.
discovered_by: GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research

name: Nihonium
summary: Nihonium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Flerovium
summary: Flerovium is a superheavy synthetic chemical element.

name: Moscovium
summary: Moscovium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Livermorium
summary: Livermorium is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Tennessine
summary: Tennessine is a synthetic chemical element.

name: Oganesson
summary: Oganesson is a radioactive synthetic chemical element.
